required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: the Prognosis of Fetoscopy Treatment of Twin Transfusion Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: the Prognosis of Fetoscopy Treatment of Twin Transfusion Syndrome in Shengjing Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Fetal medicine in China is still a new, young discipline, and the development is very rapid. After nearly 10 years of development, the clinical diagnosis and treatment guidelines of some complicated twin diseases has been established. Among them, twin-to-twin-transfusion syndrome (TTTS) is serious disease in twin pregnancy, and the factors affecting prognosis after fetoscopic laser surgery are part of the study. Through this study, the investigators expect to achieve better prediction indicators of the prognosis of TTTS.

detailed_description.textblock: A better guideline for twin-to-twin-transfusion syndrome are anticipated to be established in China. Fetoscopic laser surgery is applied to treat TTTS. After surgery, better prediction indicators of the prognosis of TTTS are needed.

primary_outcome.description: Including twin pregnancy of TTTS after fetoscopic laser surgery measured by nurses

secondary_outcome.description: Including adaptive, gross motor, fine motor, language, and social function; assessed using Gesell Developmental Schedules.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
TTTS after fetoscopic laser surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
Pregnant women who refuse to take part in the study

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of the second obstetrical department
